verses.plain: Hear this, all ye people; give ear, all ye inhabitants of the world:

tokens.t: Hear this, all
people; give ear, all
inhabitants of the world:

verses.plain: Both low and high, rich and poor, together.

tokens.t: Both low and high, rich and poor, together.

verses.plain: My mouth shall speak of wisdom; and the meditation of my heart shall be of understanding.

tokens.t: My mouth shall speak of wisdom; and the meditation of my heart
of understanding.

verses.plain: I will incline mine ear to a parable: I will open my dark saying upon the harp.

tokens.t: I will incline mine ear to a parable: I will open my dark saying upon the harp.

verses.plain: Wherefore should I fear in the days of evil, when the iniquity of my heels shall compass me about?

tokens.t: Wherefore should I fear in the days of evil,
the iniquity of my heels shall compass me about?

verses.plain: They that trust in their wealth, and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches;

tokens.t: They that trust in their wealth, and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches;

verses.plain: None of them can by any means redeem his brother, nor give to God a ransom for him:

tokens.t: None
can by any means redeem his brother, nor give to God a ransom for him:

verses.plain: (For the redemption of their soul is precious, and it ceaseth for ever:)

tokens.t: (For the redemption of their soul
precious, and it ceaseth for ever:)

verses.plain: That he should still live for ever, and not see corruption.

tokens.t: That he should still live for ever,
not see corruption.

verses.plain: For he seeth that wise men die, likewise the fool and the brutish person perish, and leave their wealth to others.

tokens.t: For he seeth
wise men die, likewise the fool and the brutish person perish, and leave their wealth to others.

verses.plain: Their inward thought is, that their houses shall continue for ever, and their dwelling places to all generations; they call their lands after their own names.

tokens.t: Their inward thought
their houses
for ever,
their dwelling places to all generations; they call
lands after their own names.

verses.plain: Nevertheless man being in honour abideth not: he is like the beasts that perish.

tokens.t: Nevertheless man
in honour abideth not: he is like the beasts
perish.

verses.plain: This their way is their folly: yet their posterity approve their sayings. Selah.

tokens.t: This their way
their folly: yet their posterity approve their sayings. Selah.

verses.plain: Like sheep they are laid in the grave; death shall feed on them; and the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; and their beauty shall consume in the grave from their dwelling.

tokens.t: Like sheep they are laid in the grave; death shall feed on them; and the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; and their beauty shall consume in the grave from their dwelling.

verses.plain: But God will redeem my soul from the power of the grave: for he shall receive me. Selah.

tokens.t: But God will redeem my soul from the power of the grave: for he shall receive me. Selah.

verses.plain: Be not thou afraid when one is made rich, when the glory of his house is increased;

tokens.t: Be not thou afraid when one is made rich, when the glory of his house is increased;

verses.plain: For when he dieth he shall carry nothing away: his glory shall not descend after him.

tokens.t: For when he dieth he shall carry nothing away: his glory shall not descend after him.

verses.plain: Though while he lived he blessed his soul: and men will praise thee, when thou doest well to thyself.

tokens.t: Though while he lived he blessed his soul: and
will praise thee, when thou doest well to thyself.

verses.plain: He shall go to the generation of his fathers; they shall never see light.

tokens.t: He shall go to the generation of his fathers; they shall never see light.

verses.plain: Man that is in honour, and understandeth not, is like the beasts that perish.

tokens.t: Man
in honour, and understandeth not, is like the beasts
perish.

footnotes.text: approve…: Heb. delight in their mouth
in the grave from…: or, the grave being an habitation to every one of them
